item.title: BASH in minutes
item.description: Bash is a shell program. A shell program is typically an executable binary that takes commands that you type and (once you hit return), translates those commands into (ultimately) system calls to the Operating System API. Note: A binary is a file that contains the instructions for a program, ie it is a ‘program’ file, rather than a ‘text’ file, or an ‘application’ file (such as a Word document).
